fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Show more link on viewfollow page doesnt show more

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Steps to reproduce
1. Go to your Network tab in your settings area. https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/users/viewfollow.action
2. Scroll to the bottom of the Recent activity
3. Click 'Show More'
4. Wait for spinner to finish.
h3. Expected Results
I see more activity from the people im following

h3. Actual Results
No further activity is returned.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Show more link on viewfollow page doesnt show more

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A page that ends with .action will cause an indefinite loop.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and name the page with suffixes .action

h3. Expected Results
Page loads fine

h3. Actual Results
Page keeps on refreshing indefinitely

h3. Workaround
No Workaround
fields.summary: Indefinite loop when accessing a page with suffixes .action

fields.description:
+*Summary*+

Updating the Page location during creation of a meeting notes page is not preserved when publishing. 

+*Steps to recreate*+
 * Method 1) Create a Meeting Notes page using the [inbuilt template|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/meeting-notes-template-937893665.html]. 
 ** Create a new child page top track a collection of meeting notes (page could be anywhere in the space, even a child page of `Meeting notes` page
 ** On the parent (Meeting notes) page , click the `Create meeting note` button which will create a new page for you to edit.
 ** Before publishing, click the move page icon (looks like a 3 folder / sub folder structure) and change the location to your desired location.
 ** Click publish and the page will end up at the parent level `Meeting note` save location instead of the specified location. 
 * Method 2) 
 ** Click '+' to create a new page and select Meeting Notes template. 
 ** Before publishing, click the move page icon (looks like a 3 folder / sub folder structure) and change the location to your desired location.
 ** Click publish and the page will end up at  save location of the page you had open when you created the new meeting note page instead of the specified location. 

+*Workaround:*+
 * Select the destination page to publish underneath first, then press the create new page button '+' from the left hand drawer and then publish the desired meeting notes when complete (without changing the location).
fields.summary: Meeting notes ignores an updated page location on publish
Multimedia Macro is disabling Inline Comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a custom Site logo(same for favicon) is uploaded in Confluence, the new/custom logo doesn't show but the color scheme of the sidebar changes.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence administration, navigate to Look and feel > Site Logo and Favicon
# Upload a custom image in Site logo(same for favicon)
# Save the changes
# The uploaded logo(and favicon) doesn't show up in the sidebar but the color scheme changes. (Even the color scheme doesn't change in case of favicon upload).

h3. Expected Results
Custom logo updated should show up in the sidebar(Same with favicon, it should show up in the sidebar)

h3. Actual Results
The uploaded custom logo(favicon) doesn't show in the sidebar

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to update Site logo and favicon in Confluence

fields.description:
Right to share just one page from personal space, we need to set restrictions to other pages that we do not want the user to see.
It would be really helpful if there is a simpler way of sharing a page.
Otherwise, it is difficult for the customer to remember to put restriction each time he creates a page.
fields.summary: Easy way to share a page from a personal Space
Error 500 is thrown when trying to insert a 'Page Index' macro into a page using the new editor

fields.description: When an existing blueprint template is updated, currently just new pages which the updated version is used will get the recent changes. This is a suggestion to have a way to get the update to old pages in which this blueprint template is being used, not only for new pages.
fields.summary: Updating a template cascade to existing pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when links are broken (internal or external) the Confluence Administrator needs to manually search for such links throughout the instance. 
 Problems with this:
 * Time Consuming
 * Prone to human-error

h3. Suggested solution

Implement a automatic link validator in Confluence. This validator would run under command of the instance administrator
h3. Why is this important
 * Reduces time spent on this repetitive task
 * Removes human-error from the check
 * Facilitates instance clean-up

h3. Workaround
Manually check each link.
fields.summary: Confluence - Link Report/Link Validator

fields.description:
h3. Description
As a Confluence user, I would like to be able to create links with custom URL protocols that are used by other applications for eg. Hansoft.
Currently, Confluence does not work with custom protocols and the link is never created.

h3. Why is this important
Companies tend to use different applications that use different protocols for their interactions. Having Confluence work with those can improve productivity, ease of use and more seamlessly jump from one app to another. 

Confluence pages with skype links which will open Skype and start call
Or a list of slack channels list with their descriptions where every channel name is a link pointing to slack and will open this channel immediately for you
fields.summary: Ability to insert custom (non-standard) URL protocols

fields.description:
h3. Roadmap Planner macro containing an image in the title of the linked page or emoji in the name of the bar throws a java exception in view mode.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with title having images (for example  📊💡)
# On another page, insert a Roadmap Planner macro and in Link Page option link the page created in the first step.
# Now publish the macro and in the view mode, it shows Error rendering macro 'roadmap' : java.io.IOException: Invalid character.
# Now remove the above linked page and add an emoji :) in the name of the macro bar. Publishing the page shows java exception error message.

h3. Expected Results
Macro content should be displayed when images, emojis are used in the content of the macro

h3. Actual Results
Macro content is not displayed in the view mode and throws an exception.

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to delete images, emojis added in the macro.

Note: Splunk logs
{code}
Error rendering macro: roadmap
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Invalid character
com.atlassian.plugins.roadmap.RoadmapMacro.execute(RoadmapMacro.java:104)
com.atlassian.confluence.macro.Macro.execute(Macro.java:33)
sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1674.invoke(Unknown Source)
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
{code}
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner throws a java exception in view mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an app has a macro linking feature (Latex Math Reference) that references another of their own macro (e.g. Latex Math Block), the first live preview displays properly and triggers a call to:

{code}
https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/cgraphql?q=MacroContentRenderer
{code}

However, when order is switch and the link macro ((Latex Math Reference)) is first created before the supposedly referenced block macro ((e.g. Latex Math Block)), it results in an error that the anchor target cannot be found *which is expected* because no references are created. Adding the referenced block macro later and trying to update the preview does not trigger a call to:

{code}
https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/cgraphql?q=MacroContentRenderer
{code}

and the live preview stays the same with the error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install LaTeX Math
# Edit an existing page, then in this order:
## Create Math Block with anchor=test1
## Wait to ensure draft has been saved (or publish/edit)
## Create Math Block Reference with anchor=test1
## Create Math Block Reference with anchor=test2
## Create Math Block with anchor=test2

Macro (3) will work fine, but (4) will continue to fail, even after giving plenty of time for the draft to update. It turns out that no new requests are being sent to the LaTeX Math server.

Replication video:
* New editor:  [^AnneReplicationNewConfluence-18Mar2019.webm] 
* Old editor: [^AnneReplicationOldConfluence-18Mar2019.webm] 

h3. Expected Results
Second reference macro will render successfully

h3. Actual Results
Second reference macro renders instantly with same error message as before

h3. Notes
* From vendor:
{quote}
actual request (headers + body) and response you're trying to invoke and receive on your end?
The issue is that I'm not receiving a new request from Confluence. The response headers when rendering the macro the first time include "max-age=30;s-maxage=30". This works as expected when viewing the page and in the old editor.
{quote}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New editor live preview does not refresh preview when some references are updated later in a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new editor experience, when doing page PDF export, if the page contains the 'columns macro' then the content of the page is truncated.

h3. How to replicate
# Create a new page, add a title and some text.
# *Add a column macro*
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish
# Export page to PDF
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results
PDF content is truncated on the left and right margins

Screenshot:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Remove the Columns macro from page and PDF will be exported correctly.
fields.summary: PDF export truncates content if Column macro is included on page (New editor)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When anonymous users search Confluence they are presented with:
{quote}
Oops, something went wrong with your search.

We could not successfully complete the search. CQL was parsed but the search manager was unable to execute the search. CQL: 'siteSearch ~ "Transfer"'. Error message: java.util.NoSuchElementException: No value present
{quote}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to any public page with a search window (do not log in). e.g https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACEKEY>/pages/<pagenum>
2. Enter a search term and click Search.
3. You're presented with the following error:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

*Notes:*
Users with a login can search and results are returned.
fields.summary: Oops, something went wrong with your search. (Anonymous users)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the new editor, macros are rendered with output.type=display once save is clicked in edit macro screen even if the page/blog/content is not yet published. The old editor rendered them with output.type=preview until publish is clicked.

This change makes it impossible to make the macro render consistently with the contents of the page it is being rendered on, since my add-on cannot know that it should request the draft version (confluence sends the most recent published version number, which in fact is wrong). Sending the wrong page number is also a bug.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dynamic macro 
# Pass {{output.type}} context parameter in the URL
# Add the dynamic macro using the new editor
# Hit "Save" button in the edit macro dialog

h3. Expected Results
A way to differentiate that the page is still in edit page view.

h3. Actual Results
Hitting "Save" in edit macro view triggers a call to the dynamic macro URL with {{output.type}} equal to {{display}}. See screen capture http://recordit.co/viZhU5iSux

h3. Workaround
Calling the `AP.navigator.getLocation()` api in the frontend javascript code will allow the app to figure out whether it is in view mode or edit mode: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/jsapi/navigator/
fields.summary: No way to tell if macro request comes from editor or normal page view

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the Fabric editor, paste a URL for a page on the same site
 # It is turned into a macro
 # Paste the same URL as 'http:'
 # It remains as a regular link

h3. Expected Results

The mistake of using a non-https link is silently corrected, and the URL is treated the same as an https link.

h3. Actual Results

The URL is turned into a link, but not promoted to a macro. As Cloud sets `strict-transport-security`, browsers won't actually make a plaintext connection.

h3. Workaround

Fix the link before pasting.
fields.summary: Non-https internal links aren't recognised in the Fabric editor

fields.description:
h2. Scenario:
 Users should be prompted with a login screen when coming from a direct link or when clicking an e-mail link.

h2. Current Behavior:
 Users are redireted to the linked page, but instead of loading it (that sometimes is not obvious) an error "Page Tree Failed to Load"is displayed.
 !PageTreeFailedToLoad.PNG|thumbnail!

h2. Expected Behavior:
 User should be prompted to login into Confluence, instead of displaying the current error message.
fields.summary: Prompt users to login when comming from a direct link

fields.description:
Nav V2 can take the whole page down if it encounters a JS error.
We need to add sensible error boundaries to prevent this
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Add Error Boundaries to Nav V2

fields.description:
Some users would like to be able to disable commenting on a pages without the need of changing the Space permissions for groups or users, which would prevent them to add comments in a given Space at all.

It would be simpler if the user could disable comments for pages individually.
fields.summary: Ability to disable/hide comment box

fields.description:
Per https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html, the HTML Comment macro is going to be removed, with the following proposed alternate approach:

"If you want to leave a comment on a page that isn't visible to your readers, you can do this by making the text white. Alternatively, add a change comment when you publish your page."

We routinely use the HTML Comment macro to add usage instructions and variable defaults to our page templates; this allows us to insert more complex directions than what your current template editor allows. The proposed alternate would not meet our needs and would impact multiple teams and how they interact with Confluence.

We need one of the following:

 - Keep the HTML Comment macro
 - Some kind of alternate option for presenting complex content (including macros that can be copy/pasted) to a user when they're editing a page but that is not visible when viewing the published page
 - A broad expansion in the ability to use variables and input fields when creating a new page so that I don't have to rely on the HTML Comment macro to present users with a list of stock options when creating a new page
fields.summary: Keep the HTML Comment Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Links to Anchors in TinyMCE pages instead open a new page in the Editor.
h3. Environment

TinyMCE Editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an anchor to a TinyMCE Page.
 # Add a link pointing to that anchor and save page.
 # Click on link.

h3. Expected Results

Link takes you to the anchor in the page.
h3. Actual Results

Link takes you to a new page in the Editor.
h3. Notes
 * In some cases, links to Anchors in TinyMCE pages open a draft page in the Editor

h3. Workaround

Delete the existing broken link and recreating it should fix this issue.
fields.summary: Links to Anchors in TinyMCE pages instead open a new page in the Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The button to edit the welcome message send us to a *Page not found* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Confluence Settings*
# Click on *Global Templates and Blueprints*
# Scroll down and next to *Default Welcome Message* click on *Edit*

h3. Expected Results
We are directed to a screen where we can set the default welcome message

h3. Actual Results
Page not found
!Screen Shot 2019-03-15 at 11.24.56.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Unable to edit the welcome message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, using Code Block, Page Properties, Background Color macros shows a mixed/insecure content warning in the web console.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Create a new page in Confluence
# Insert *Code Block* macro
# Close the page without publishing (saving as a draft)
# Reopen the draft and in the web console mixed/insecure warning message is shown

h3. Expected Results
Content in Confluence should be of the same protocol (HTTPS)

h3. Actual Results
Mixed/insecure (HTTP) content is loaded

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mixed content warning message is shown when macros are used in Confluence

fields.description:
In Confluence Server, the Office Connector allowed setting the maximum height and width of images during the import of Word Documents.

Confluence Cloud's Word Import function does not have this option, and it resizes images to be maximum 900px wide.

Allowing to set the width and height of the images, as in Server would be preferable, as it would result in better imports.
fields.summary: Allow to select Image size during Word Import

fields.description: Provide ability/feature in Confluence to deactivate users automatically after 3 months of inactivity.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment

In a new editor, in certain circumstances

Steps to Reproduce
 # create a new page using new eidtor
 # add some comments
 # edit the page, add more content and publish the page

h3. Expected Results

1. Only affected by edit comments are deleted (if anchor text is gone)
h3. Actual Results

1. all inline comments get resolved.
h3. Notes

This doesn't happen always and it's not clear what leads to it
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Editing a page resolves all inline comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding Markdown via the Markup tool into Confluence Page will render in Confluence Wiki view instead of Markdown
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page (any type, tested on Blank)
 # Click on Insert More Content drop down menu
 # Switch to markdown mode and Insert a Markdown code
 !Screenshot 2019-03-15 at 11.04.08 AM.png|thumbnail! 
 ^ The preview renders correctly
 # Insert to page

h3. Expected Results

Codes are rendered in Markdown
h3. Actual Results

Codes are rendered in Confluence Wiki format instead of Markdown.
 !Screenshot 2019-03-15 at 11.04.18 AM.png|thumbnail!

Error appears on the Console:
{code:java}
[Error] SyntaxError: JSON Parse error: Unexpected identifier "MARKDOWN"
	parse (atlassian-editor-plugins.d029127af5fa4a104e5c-v38.js:1:176019)
	Mn (atlassian-editor-plugins.d029127af5fa4a104e5c-v38.js:1:176019)
	(anonymous function) (atlassian-editor-plugins.d029127af5fa4a104e5c-v38.js:1:179932)
	execCommand (vendors~atlassian-editor.cf420a9674f38f58ca00-v38.js:1:27887)
	b (batch.js:508:511)
	(anonymous function) (atlassian-editor-plugins.d029127af5fa4a104e5c-v38.js:1:160984)
	(anonymous function) (atlassian-editor-plugins.d029127af5fa4a104e5c-v38.js:1:161102)
	dispatch (jquery-min.js:1:32141)
	a (jquery-min.js:1:27832)
{code}
h3. Notes

There is another bug reported which might be related: CONFCLOUD-65841: Markup macros prompt no longer popup the second time
h3. Workaround
 * Please use [Confluence Wiki|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-wiki-markup-251003035.html] as there is no workaround to use Markdown at the moment.
 * Use Markdown to Wiki Converter tool: [http://chunpu.github.io/markdown2confluence/browser/]
 * Create pages using the new editor instead as the new editor is not affected by this bug
fields.summary: Markdown is saved as Confluence Wiki on the preview regardless of language mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding Markup Macros into Confluence Page will popup the "Insert Markup" panel the first time and inserting another Markup, the popup panel no longer appears the second time for all browser. However, removing cache will reset the count and issue reappears. This issue happens to all browsers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page (any type, tested on Blank)
 # Click on Insert More Content drop down menu

h3. Expected Results
Markup popup panel appears

h3. Actual Results
Inserting the Markup the second time will not show the "Insert Markup" popup panel

Error appears on the Console:
{code}
[Error] SyntaxError: JSON Parse error: Unexpected identifier "MARKDOWN"
	parse (atlassian-editor-plugins.d029127af5fa4a104e5c-v38.js:1:176019)
	Mn (atlassian-editor-plugins.d029127af5fa4a104e5c-v38.js:1:176019)
	(anonymous function) (atlassian-editor-plugins.d029127af5fa4a104e5c-v38.js:1:179932)
	execCommand (vendors~atlassian-editor.cf420a9674f38f58ca00-v38.js:1:27887)
	b (batch.js:508:511)
	(anonymous function) (atlassian-editor-plugins.d029127af5fa4a104e5c-v38.js:1:160984)
	(anonymous function) (atlassian-editor-plugins.d029127af5fa4a104e5c-v38.js:1:161102)
	dispatch (jquery-min.js:1:32141)
	a (jquery-min.js:1:27832)
{code}

h3. Notes
The panel will appears for the first time on each Browser.
This issue might be interrelated with Markdown codes being rendered in Confluence Wiki format after inserting it on the page hence the error mentioned "Markdown": [CONFCLOUD\-65842:  Markdown is saved as Confluence Wiki on the preview regardless of language mode|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65842]

h3. Workaround
\- As a quick workaround, run browser in Incognito Mode or remove browser cache for "atlassian.net" to have the Markup popup once again.
\- No permanent workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Markup macros prompt no longer popup the second time

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Subscribe to Atlassian Access and set up SAML SSO using certificate authentication
# Using a mobile phone which have the certificate installed, confirm that user is able to access their instance by Safari(or other browsers)
# Try accessing the same instance from the same platform using the Confluence Cloud iOS app

h3. Expected Results
User is able to access their instance

h3. Actual Results
The process stops after account/password verification
fields.summary: Support SSO using digital certificates in the iOS app

fields.description:
Similar to the [deprecated Multimedia macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/multimedia-macro-724765227.html], while using the new editor and attaching a Multimedia file (e.g. audio files and videos) is useful, there are no methods to have the video/audio to display directly on the page without needing to use the *Preview* option.

This is a suggestion to have a method to display and play multimedia files for the new editor without needing to use the *preview* option.
fields.summary: Multimedia embedder for the new editor

fields.description: Allow users to customize the width of the page in the new editor. Customers have reported that it would be great to be able to personalize the width of the page while editing it.
fields.summary: Allow users to customize page width in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When searching for the exact page title in the advanced search, it will not display it as the first result if the text of the page title is present in any other content of the instance for example attachment name, as a text in any other page etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
The page with the title matching with the search should be displayed in the first position.

h3. Why this is important
Customers want their search to be more accurate and specific to the page they are searching.
 
h3. Workaround 
Search using *Title Search*, for example- title: Name of the page OR search the title in double quotes "name of the page"
fields.summary: Allow Confluence Search to be accurate for page titles

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

The meeting notes are created slowly and showing the same in the *HAR* file with high wait times.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results

It should be creating it instantly

h3. Actual Results

{code:java}
Long server processing time
The server took a long time to respond. This may indicate some overload or problem in the server side

‡
Blocked time
8 ms
DNS time
Does not apply.
Connection time
Does not apply.
Send time
0 ms
Wait time
5342 ms
Receive time
4423 ms
SSL time
Does not apply. {code}
fields.summary: Meeting notes creation shows high wait times

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
Paragraph (normal text) within Parent Section that contains a child section macros will not be rendered in Firefox browser
h3. *Steps to Replicate*

*Scenario 1*
 # Create a page containing a Section within a Section (two section all together)
 # Add a paragraph text inside the parent section (above the child section)
 !Screenshot 2019-03-14 at 4.57.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Actual Result
Text-Paragraph doesn't render:
 !Screenshot 2019-03-14 at 4.59.38 PM.png|thumbnail! 

*Scenario 2*
 # Create a page containing a Section within a Section (two section all together)
 # Add a paragraph text inside the parent section and inside the child section:
 !Screenshot 2019-03-14 at 4.57.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Actual Result
Text-Paragraph Parent doesn't render
 !Screenshot 2019-03-14 at 5.00.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Expected Result for Both Scenario
Text between the Parent and Child section are visible 
 
h3. Workaround
-
fields.summary: Paragraph (normal text) within Parent Section that contains a child section macros will is not rendered in Firefox browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As a user when restricting a page or having a space where confluence-users has no read permission by default I am potentially expelling apps from executing their function in the space as every app utilizes a user that needs at least read permission.

Why are the users coming from apps and their superordinate group not allowed to read by default? As the group atlassian-addons-admin is mostly not visible also to admins, I suggest to have read permissions for all users coming from app. But not visible in spaces.

h3. Expected Results
App users can read pages, blogs, and contents even if it has restrictions.
fields.summary: Ability for app generated users to read restricted content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Links on Confluence Cloud iOS app are not working

h3. Environment

* Confluence Cloud iOS App (v. 2.32.1.3)
* iOS 12.1.2 (16C104)
* iPhone 8

(Tested in, but no exclusive to)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page
# Add some links to it (other domains, and even Confluence itself)
# Publish the Page 
# In mobile app (iOS), go to the same published page and tap those links

h3. Expected Results
You are redirected to the links you've clicked

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Workaround 1 - Use a mobile browser (Safari, Chrome, etc) to access Confluence and navigate through links
Workaround 2 - Long press on link - a prompt will show up to open with mobile browser
fields.summary: Links on Confluence Cloud iOS app are not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Wiki markup list alignment is not working properly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Insert some markup as in the picture below
!markup.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
!Expected.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
!Result.png|thumbnail!
It is possible to notice a bigger gap between the lists

h3. Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Markup - list alignment not working properly

fields.description:
h3. The Suggestion
Currently there is no way to track down who downloaded, or uploaded an attachment on Confluence Cloud. 

It would be nice to know who performed the download under the audit log for the instance.
fields.summary: Audit Log for Attachment actions
When managing apps, if the admin clicks "+ Build a new app", Confluence throws a "Page Not Found"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you click the like button from the email notification you received more than 7 days ago, you will be redirected to a 401 - Unauthorized error. Accessing the page using the "View Page" button from the email notification works.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud notification

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User A watched a page 
# User B Edit the same page and notify the watchers
# User A received a notification
# User A click on the like button from the email after 7 days

h3. Expected Results
* Like button from email notification should not have an expiration 

h3. Actual Results
* Like button from email notification has an expiration
 
h3. Workaround
- Use the View Page option from the email notification and like the page directly.
fields.summary: Like Button from notification has expiration

fields.description:
In Confluence Cloud, there are two options to export/import data, one is to generate a full site backup and to import it with *Import Site* feature, and the other one is to generate individual space exports and to import them with *Import Spaces* feature.

The issue is that when we have both Jira and Confluence on the same site, the *Import Site* feature it is not available, and this might be misleading for the customers as they use a full site backup for *Import Spaces* and then this fails with an error

!Screen Shot 2019-03-13 at 10.48.40.png|thumbnail!

Can we please review the note from the Import Spaces feature and provide more details to the users about these processes and the advice of what they should do?

 

This ticket relates to a CONFDEV ticket currently in progress: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-62272
fields.summary: Provide clear errors messages when customers try to import site-imports in the Space Import option

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Code is blocked by the floating toolbar in the new editor if the code block is at the bottom of the page, which make it difficult to input or verify code.

 !image-2019-03-13-09-40-46-180.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 
Add extra line after the code block at the bottom of the page so the toolbar is displayed underneath the code block. For example:
 !image-2019-03-13-09-44-42-019.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Suggested Solution
To always show Code toolbar outside of the code block
fields.summary: Allow the code toolbar to always show at the bottom outside of the code block

fields.description:
I want to create task lists for myself in Confluence without having to @ mention myself every time. (I tend to have really long task lists so this gets a bit tedious.)

 

Ideally there would be a panel or something where I could put all my personal tasks - no at-mention required - and then they would roll up along with all of my other tasks.

 

Here is another user who was looking for something similar: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/What-is-the-best-way-to-make-a-to-do-list-in-Confluence/qaq-p/933322
fields.summary: Create personal task lists without having to @mention myself

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to use Slack to create tasks in my Confluence Cloud project spaces. Including assigning team members and due dates.

I searched but couldn't find this request anywhere.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Turn a Slack message into a Confluence task

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Wide images will be rendered over the inline comments box on pages created with the new editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and insert text
# Insert a wide image and make it full-width by drag-and-dropping its side
# Publish the page
# Try to add an inline comment or view any inline comments

h3. Expected Results
The inline comments box should be rendered over the image

h3. Actual Results
The inline comments box is rendered under the image:
|  !Screen Shot 2019-03-12 at 20.07.12.png|thumbnail!  |


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Wide images overlap inline comments box on the new editor

fields.description:
Clicking on advance search from quick search results in a page not found
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # make sure confluence.frontend.nav.v2 FF is *off*
 # go to any SPA page (activity, my work, normal confluence page)
 # open quick search
 # click on advanced search

h2. Expected Behaviour

Advance search screen to show with search query
h2. Actual Behaviour

"page not found" 
h2. Workaround

refresh the page loads advanced search screen correctly

alternatively switch on confluence.frontend.nav.v2 FF
fields.summary: Advance search page is showing "page not found"

fields.description:
Currently, in Confluence Cloud, if you are a Space Admin, you are able to view and remove restrictions from pages within a space.

However, if you are trying to access a page that's inheriting restrictions from its parent page, there's no way for you to know that this is a inherited restriction and that it can be removed by unrestricting the parent page.
fields.summary: Better Visualization of Inherited Restrictions as a Space Admin

fields.description:
Currently, Basic users are not able to invite other users, but they are prompted to invite users during their signup process. 

This creates confusion during onboarding as the expectation is that invites were sent out.

There is a feature which enables Basic users to be able to invite others during signup (or rather, make requests that need Site Admin Approval), and the prompt makes sense there. Could the feature be modified so it better reflects the process?
fields.summary: Do not show "Invite users" during Basic user signup if they aren't able to invite others.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Firefox, Edge or Internet Explorer, users are not being able to have new pages created by using the "Create/+" button on the sidebar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to use Firefox, Edge or Internet Explorer
 # Tap the "+" icon on the sidebar

h3. Expected Results

The create page dialog should open in a popup and allow the user to proceed with the creation process.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens. No dialog is triggered.

h3. Workaround

Use Google Chrome or Safari.
fields.summary: Specific instances cannot create pages using Firefox and Edge

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, Confluence doesn't have the capability to use a paragraph indentation by using the *TAB* keyboard key and even copying and pasting this formatting from an external source (like an e-mail or Word/PDF file text), it doesn't keep the original format.
h3. Environment


* Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

By copying from an external source (you can use the attached file as an example - [^Paragraph indentation.docx]):
 # Copy the paragraph from the file;
 # Paste it in a Confluence page (an existing one or not, in the tiny or fabric version).

By trying to insert it manually:
 # Write a 3 lines paragraph;
 # Press the *TAB* keyboard key, in the first paragraph line.

h3. Expected Results

The copying example:
 * The paragraph should come with the same indentation than the source

The manual example:
 * Hitting *TAB* should get only the first line indented.

h3. Actual Results

The copying example:
 * The paragraph comes with a Confluence default indentation.

The manual example:
 * Hitting *TAB* gets all the paragraph indented.

 
h3. Workaround

We do not have a workaround. I've tried to hit the *SPACE* keyboard key instead of *TAB* at the first paragraph line, and it sent me to a new line.
fields.summary: Paragraph indentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence is showing "Page Not Found" when checking the tabs Space List from Welcome Message.

h3. Customer Impact
User can't access the spaces correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Settings > Global Templates and Blueprints*
# Edit the *Default Welcome Message* template and add the Space list macro
# Go to Confluence's homepage (Activity tab)
# Click on any tab on the Space List macro
!screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
* Show the favourite spaces/space categories/new spaces based on the option

h3. Actual Results
User got redirected to -
* All tab: https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/$%7Bbaseurl%7DspacesSelectedTab=all
* Favourite tab: https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/$%7Bbaseurl%7DspacesSelectedTab=favourite
* Category tab: https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/$%7Bbaseurl%7DspacesSelectedTab=category
* New tab: https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/$%7Bbaseurl%7DspacesSelectedTab=new

!screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* Space list is working fine when accessing from a space
fields.summary: Space list macro doesn't work on Activity tab

fields.description:
At this moment, it is not possible to uncheck all tasks in a given page.  If a user needs/want to reuse the same set of tasks it is necessary to uncheck these manually.

It would be great to have an option to uncheck all tasks from a page so whenever a set of tasks need to be reused, it would make things easier and faster.
fields.summary: Ability to uncheck all tasks in a page

fields.description:
In the fabric editor, the pdf on a page is blank grey.
In the old editor, it used to display the first page. 
The customer would like the same feature to be present in the new editor.
fields.summary: PDF inserted should show the first page as in old editor

fields.description: As a space admin, I would like to be able to have a different sidebar color for each of my Confluence Cloud spaces
fields.summary: Allow Different Sidebar Colors for Individual Spaces

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
The User Profile Macros has limited information about users.

h3. *Suggestion*
Include more functions and flexibility for the macros. Example from an old Team Space Overview Page:
 !The team.PNG!
fields.summary: Extend the User Profile Macros functionality

fields.description:
Hi!

+Solution:+

Create and give vendors access to Confluence Cloud 'test' servers where builds are deployed to *prior* to their general release. I believe all Cloud vendors could peacefully co-exist on a few such servers.

+The problem:+

Increasingly code is being deployed to Confluence Cloud which is causing issues for (I think its safe to say) several thousands of customers. Only vendors seem to be able to find these issues as the platforms are not really dog fooded the way app vendors leverage them.

A few examples of pretty significant issues this could alleviate :
 * CONFCLOUD-62749
 * CONFCLOUD-64923
 * [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AC-2483]

These are not minor issues, rather blocker issues, unresolved for weeks causing major customer disruption, being unable to use critical functionality they depend on without warning.....though preventable.

 

This suggestion is made with the interest of giving vendors the ability to aid Atlassian in testing, supplement platform stability and most importantly increase customer joy.

If you're a customer or vendor and would like to increase reliability, stability and customer satisfaction please vote for this issue or offer even better solutions :)
fields.summary: Create Confluence Cloud 'test' servers where vendors can access platform builds prior to general deployment

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*

Commenting the Page version history isn't possible because the comment box for page version history is missing from the Publish bar on the bottom of the page for the new editor

 

Here's the missing comment box:
 !Screenshot 2019-03-11 at 10.50.49 AM.png|width=473,height=71!

 

As a result, comment section will be emptied as there isn't a way to input them:
 !Screenshot 2019-03-11 at 10.50.00 AM.png|width=1051,height=113!
fields.summary: History Comment input box missing from the New Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the old editor, the macro name is displayed in the macro placeholder during edit. In the new editor, the macro key is used.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In both old and new editor, add the same 3rd-party macro
 # In edit mode, compare the heading of both macro placeholders 

h3. Expected Results
Consistent heading i.e. macro name is used for both

h3. Actual Results
In the old editor displays macro name, in the new editor macro key is displayed.
 !old-editor-shows-name.png|thumbnail! 
 !new-editor-shows-keys.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in 3rd-party macro heading

fields.description:
On long pages, when you are at the end of the document, there is no space below your cursor, making it uncomfortable to type. 

In addition, any elements that have a toolbar can cover up your content.
fields.summary: New editor should have a buffer at the bottom of the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, if you try filtering the results of the Page Properties Report macro *by ID*, the report does not update once the page is published.

h3. Environment
- New Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add a Page Properties Macro on it, and set an ID
# Now, create a new page and add a Page Properties Report Macro
# Filter the results by ID
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The Report would only show pages that have a Page Properties macro with a given ID

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't filter by ID. In other cases, it will only show 1 result.

h3. Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Page Properties ID not being fetched by Page Properties Report Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, if you set your data from the Page Properties Macro, to be a *Status Macro*, once you publish your Page Properties report, it will still display the old Status Macro layout, instead of the new one

h3. Environment
- New Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page, and insert a Page Properties Macro
# On the macro's table, insert a Status macro
# Now, create a new page, and insert a Page Properties Report macro that displays the page created on step 1
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The Page Properties Report would mirror the content of the page

h3. Actual Results
It displays the old editor 'style'.

h3. Workaround
None so far
fields.summary: Page Property Report is displaying old Status layout even though the source Status are from the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding google drive widget connect doesn't display the doc and doc looks broken
h3. Environment

a page
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # created test page 

 # created test google doc and published it so it is accessible to the public. 

 # Added widget connector and added shared linked.
 # saved page and confluence page reports that document isn't published 
 # confirm google doc is accessible

*Expected Results*

when trying to click on macro in viewing mode, we have a doc displayed
h3. Actual Results

when trying to click on macro in viewing mode, we get a broken doc
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

add doc in a different ways possible
fields.summary: Adding google drive widget connector results in a broken doc

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The resource to link a personal space in a page is not working. According to the public article *[Insert Links and Anchors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/insert-links-and-anchors-724764900.html]*, in the *Link to a personal space or user profile* session, it should be possible.
This mentioned session was added to the article on Sep 15, 2017.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a page you want to link the personal space;
 # Click in the *Edit* button;
 # Type *[* and then enter the user's name and select their personal space overview.

h3. Expected Results

The personal space option appears as an option to be linked in the page, right after typing *[* and the user name.
h3. Actual Results

The personal space option is not available to be linked, but only the user profile appears
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to link a Personal Space to a page

fields.description:
It would be great if users could select the way the attachments added to their pages should behave when selected (open in a new tab/window or in preview mode).

Depending on the attachment nature (document, image, video, ...) it could make navigation through the content easier if this option was added to the product.
fields.summary: Ability to set a rule to open specific attachments on a new window/tab

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, the default value for the purge of the UPM (Universal Plugin Manager) on Confluence Cloud is set to 90 days, and cannot be changed.

h3. The Suggestion
Allow users to set the purge time to ensure better auditing.
fields.summary: Allow admins to change UPM Audit Log purge time.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to @mention users in any Confluence page, it doesn't work. This only happens for *specific users* in the instance.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to reproduce 
# Create a new default page 
# @mention users

h3. Expected behavior 
Confluence should allow users to @mention any active user that has access to the application.

h3. Workaround
Disable and enable Confluence application access for the user you cannot @mention. 

*OR* use _[~nameoftheuser_ instead of _@_.
fields.summary: Cannot @mention specific users in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Images added to Confluence, don't load in iOS app when not connected to the internet. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Current behavior 
At the moment, once a page that contains images is loaded in the iOS app while connected to a network, it won't load the image when the connection is turned off. 

h3. Expected behavior
Just like the Android the app, it should be possible to save information in cache on the app to view pages offline. 

h3. Notes
External images do load in the iOS and Android app successfully.
fields.summary: Images/attachments don't load in iOS pages when not connected to the internet

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary'
Currently, if you attach an image on the new editor, and afterwards, upload a new version of the same file under the *Attachment's File Picker*, the name of the page becomes the attachment's ID.

h3. Environment
- New Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Choose a file that is not rendered in the page (DOCX, and PDF works)
# First edit a page (new editor) and drag and drop the file to the page
#* At this moment the latest version of the attachment is still the one added in the page, so it won't cause the issue
# Now, click '... >> Attachments' to go to the attachments page
# Upload the same file with the same name to add a new version to it
# Once the file is uploaded, go back to the page or refresh it if you have it open in another tab


h3. Expected Results
The attachment would be attached and its actual name is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
You'll see the ID rather than the name

h3. Workaround
Reupload the file from the Editor.
fields.summary: Attaching the latest version of a file from the Attachments Page breaks the attachment name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have [Loremipsum Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/loremipsum-macro-724765226.html] in the Old Editor. Editing the page will load it in Fabric Editor but it hangs and there's no way to edit the page.  

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the Old editor, add a Loremipsum Macro
# Opt-in to Confluence new experience
# Edit the page that you created in step 1 

h3. Expected Results
* Should be able to edit the page in Fabric Editor 


h3. Actual Results
* Unable to edit the page in Fabric Editor. 

h3. Workaround
- none
fields.summary: New Confluence Editor is unavailable when editing an existing page with Loremipsum Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a page using a template with variables on the new editor, it won't be possible to populate the variables.

h3. Environment
 * New editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On an instance with the new editor enabled, create a new template
# Create a variable on the template and save the template
# Create a new page using this template

h3. Expected Results
It should be possible for the user to populate the variable

h3. Actual Results
The variable is not shown, and no "wizard" is shown before editing the page to populate the variables


h3. Workaround
No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Not possible to populate variables on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The markdown content is not rendered when inserted on the Markup macro and selecting the "Markdown" syntax.

h3. Environment
- Old editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Insert a Markup Macro
# Choose *Markdown* on the syntax selector
# Paste the Markdown text
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The page would render the content properly

h3. Actual Results
The raw Markdown text is inserted. 

h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Inserting Markdown on Markup Macro does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to [the Global Permissions article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/global-permissions-overview-724765488.html], administrators of Confluence should be able to change the permissions for the actions of the groups. However, if the user is not a *site-admin* and only an administrator of Confluence, the option to change the permissions will be greyed out.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, make sure to have groups already added to the Global Permissions (through the *application access* of the administration).
 # After that, have a user that is an administrator of Confluence, but, not a site-admin.
# With the administrator, make sure to access the *Global Permissions* (from the *Settings* menu of Confluence) and tap the *edit* option

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to edit the global permissions.

h3. Actual Results

The options are all greyed out when trying to edit the same:

!global.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Contact the site-admin to perform such changes.
fields.summary: Administrator not able to change group permissions on Global Permissions

fields.description:
Flow for creating a space failed in multiple ways.
h3. Reproduction
 # Create a new instance (not sure if this is necessary)
 # Start to create a new space
 # Name the space test
 ## Observe:
 'Create' button is disabled with no error text telling you what's wrong  !image-2019-03-07-13-36-57-617.png!

 # Select the space name field.
 # Type a character then delete it
 ## Observe:
 "You must enter a space key" appears even though the space key is filled out.
 Create button disabled
 !image-2019-03-07-13-37-40-859.png!

 # Select the space key field
 # Add a character and remove it
 ## Observe:
 The warning text goes away
 'Create' button is enabled
 Create button doesn't do anything
 !image-2019-03-07-13-37-57-517.png!

 # Select the space name field again
 # Add a character and keep it
 ## Observe:
 The space key loses it's fourth character and becomes "TES"
 The Create button now works
 !image-2019-03-07-13-38-23-071.png!
fields.summary: Creating a space flow bug

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, it is not possible to use any of the functionalities from the Page Properties Report Macro on the new editing experience.

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Create a page with a Page Properties Macro
# Create a new page and add a Page Properties Report macro
# Publish the page
# Now, edit the page again, and try using any of the filters from the page properties report macro on the new editor
# Publish the page again

h3. Expected Results
The filters would work, such as changing the title or sorting pages based on something.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing works after the page is published
fields.summary: None of the options from Page Properties Report macro works on New Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you click on a link from a Label List Macro/Popular labels macro, you receive a *Page Not Found* error, despite it working if you open the link in a new tab.

h3. Environment
- Old and New Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create some pages and add some labels to it
# Now, in another page, add a *Label List Macro*/*Popular labels macro*
# Publish the page
# Click on a link from the label list macro/Popular labels macro

h3. Expected Results
You would be redirected to the list of pages including the label you've clicked

h3. Actual Results
You get a Page Not Found

h3. Workaround
Open the link in a new tab or refresh the page.
fields.summary: Clicking a link from a Label List Macro/Popular labels macro results in a "Page Not Found"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence, when one of the administrators execute a "[Site backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/create-a-site-backup-724765526.html]", and then, go to the [Audit logs of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/audit-log-802164269.html], the user who performed the operation is displayed as "Anonymous", instead of the user that did it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an administrator, access the *Settings* of Confluence
# There, look for *Site backup*
# On this part, tap the *Create backup* button
# Still on the *Settings* of Confluence, select the *Audit Logs* option that will be on the sidebar.
# Check the backup action and the user that executed it.

h3. Expected Results

The user field should be displayed as the user who executed the action, instead of anonymous:

!backup.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

The user that executed the backup should be displayed on the user field.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Audit logs displaying "Anonymous" for users who execute a site backup

fields.description:
h3. https://imgur.com/1BakNtX
h3.  
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever a user is deleted and recreated later, the space name is not updated again to reflect the user and shows Unknown User (User Key) instead
h3. Environment

Conf Cloud
 *
 *
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a personal space and a few pages within the space
 # Delete the user account that created the space and pages
 # Recreate user with same e-mail address
 # View personal space again

h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unknown User (User Key) on Confluence personal space after deleting/recreating user account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a regression of [this fixed bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-59958], this is a new report with the same symptoms that confirmed to be happening and affecting additional macros like the [Livesearch one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/livesearch-macro-724765225.html] that has a limited number of results to be retrieved. However, testing with new pages/instances, we can reproduce the behavior again.

h3. Summary
When using the Confluence search, if trying to search for characters matching exactly a page title, the same will not be displayed as a first result, besides when it has been updated. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, make sure to have a page with a specific title (In this example, let's use "*Starry eyed*" as a title)
# Make sure that the same page title is displayed on different pages, so we can have additional results.
# Save the pages and make sure to search for the page title in Confluence's advanced search.

h3. Expected Results
The page with the title matching with the search should be displayed in the first position.

h3. Actual Results
Pages with the page's title as text in the body will be displayed first.
 
h3. Notes

* A new example found from the second test is that this will affect on the results of the *Livesearch* macro, as the same has a limited number of results to be displayed:

!livesearch.png|thumbnail!

Some examples of the experience are in the screenshots below. Also, trying with different search filters presenting different results:

*Bug's behavior. Notice that the page with the title matching the search is displayed in the bottom, instead of the top:*

!starry1.png|thumbnail!

*If searching for words in the title. Not the full page title text:*

!starry2.png|thumbnail!

*If searching for the exact page title between quotes. The page is displayed as a first result:*

!starry3.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Search for the title between using quotes.
fields.summary: (Regression) [Backend] Confluence Search Results Are Not Accurate for Page Titles

to dogfood Create Page Drawer v2 in Pug and Staging Instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is not possible to Edit the restrictions of a calendar that has a former user with restrictions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a calendar that has a former user with restrictions
 # Click on the *ellipsis* next to the calendar
 # Click on restrictions
 # Try to add a new group/user in the restrictions
 # Click *ok*

h3. Expected Results
New user/group added in the restriction

h3. Actual Results
A blank page and the restrictions remain the same
!Blank page.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Delete the *former user* before editing the restrictions
fields.summary: Team calendars - Not possible to edit calendar restrictions if there is a former user with restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Additional Section/Columns Layout Options
h3. Description

In the old editor, there were more options in how content could be split in a Confluence page.

Old Editor:

!screenshot-1.png|width=269,height=39,thumbnail!

New Editor:

!image-2019-03-07-11-59-27-220.png|width=157,height=53!
h3. Suggestion

Add the possibility to have 30/70 split columns, and a full-width option.
fields.summary: Additional Section/Columns Layout Options

fields.description:
In the old editor, the customers were able to use the border functionality using the section macro and column macro inside it.
But in Fabric editor, section macros are no longer present. The customer would like to have the border functionality present.
fields.summary: Ability to create borders in Fabric editor

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – Nov. 12, 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,
 
This is Sunny from the Confluence team. We know the DIV macro functionality has been critical to everyone here in formatting and configuring pages. As my colleague mentioned above, we have announced the deprecation of this macro March of last year. For transparency, after recent further discussions internally, we are currently still set in our decision to not include the DIV macro in the new editor when balancing performance of the editor vs the percentage of DIV macro users.

Thank you for your continued feedback. We have updated the status to reflect our current decision on the DIV macro, and we will provide any updates if we are able to include the DIV macro or additional similar functionality into our roadmap.

Best,

Sunny
Confluence
{panel}

The Div macros will be removed as announced in: [We're cleaning up the macro browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html]

Div macros contains some helpful features for content customisation and even workarounds:
eg. Removing links/disable links on pages as a workaround for this missing feature: [CONFCLOUD\-36736: Selectively Disable Attachment Preview|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36736]

There's currently no alternative method at the moment for either features.
fields.summary: Div macros removal feedback

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira macro does not work properly within a dynamic macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence Connect app
# Set up a dynamic macro with a rich-text body and block outputType that renders the contents of it body out using the contentbody/convert REST API
# Install the app into Confluence
# Create a page with the dynamic macro in it, and place a "Jira" macro in the body of that dynamic macro
# Place another Jira macro outside the dynamic macro
# Observe that the "Jira" macro fails to load when within the dynamic macro

h3. Expected Results
Jira macro will display like usual

h3. Actual Results
The Jira macro fails to load. Some macro shows a refresh spinner continuously spinning. Others state that refresh did not work.

If the display option is set to single issue only, the issue type icon is not rendered properly and is just displayed as a spinner.

h3. Notes
* Can be replicated in the old editor
* Used to work before. The first record of occurrence was 2nd of March
* Seems to work fine with outputType {{inline}}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Jira Macro does not render inside a 3rd-party macro
Revisit CONFCLOUD-62270 after GDPR release to fix it properly and remove the temporary solution

fields.description:
Will there be a way to convert a page created in the old editing experience to use the features of the new editing experience?

And a further question: I created a bunch of custom global templates in the old editor experience. Will I need to create new templates using the new experience and delete the old templates in order to get these templates to have the new features? Or at some point, will the existing global templates be converted?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Convert pages and templates to new editing experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The following error is thrown when trying to move a page to another location through the iOS app: _Internal Server Error_.

 !error.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to the iOS app from Confluence 
# Access a page
# Edit the page and try to set a new location for it
# Try to publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The page should be moved successfully. 

h3. Notes
Confluence Mobile app Version 2.33.0.1

h3. Workaround
Move the page through the desktop.
fields.summary: Cannot move pages in iOS app

fields.description:
The commenting feature is great but what bugs me the most is that when I am editing a page, I cannot see the comments on the text that I am editing. 

My workflow is to review comments and incorporate the comments in the body of the Confluence. However, I have to open up two tabs with one in editing mode and the other in reviewing comments mode. It'd be great if I can see the comments on the text that I am editing similar to word. Don't know how that can be done. 

The biggest pain is the constant switching back and forth between editing mode and the viewing mode.
fields.summary: Viewing comments at the time of editing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the user adds a bullet list to the content in a column (using the Fabric Editor), the columns will auto re-size to a narrow setting.

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new page in Fabric Editor
# Add columns and set them to full width
# In one of the columns add a bullet list

h3. Expected Result
Bullet list is added and no changes to the page formatting (column width) are made.

h3. Actual result
The columns will automatically re-size to the narrow default width

h3. Workaround
Manually change the column width each time a bullet list is added to the content.
fields.summary: Columns change width when bullet list is added

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Curly left bracket { in macro breaks rendering and keep spinning


h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Add table content of macro on the page
 # Add *disc{* on List style and save 
 !e.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

The macro should be able to render the content

h3. Actual Results

The macro keep spinning

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Left curly brace { in macro breaks rendering

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* a Cloud site that has existing pages migrated to the new editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a page that contains a table

h3. Expected Results
The table in the new editor has the same width/column ratio with the one set in the old editor

h3. Actual Results
The width setting is broken
 
h3. Workaround
Open the edit screen and adjust the width manually

h3. Notes
Here are the actual examples
* before migration:
 !before.png|thumbnail! 
* after migration:
 !after.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Column width setting is not respected upon migration to new editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new Confluence editing experience we don't have the ability to add a *theme* to the code block ([Code Block Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/code-block-macro-724765175.html]
 article).

Old editor (option to change them in dropdown):
 !code-block-old-editor.png|thumbnail! 

New editor (no option to change Theme):
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Workaround:
Currently, there is no known workaround for this. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New Confluence editor missing Code Block themes

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Mention a certain user in page
 # Publish 1
 # Try to edit the page

h3. Expected Results

Edit screen opens
h3. Actual Results

The following error is shown and user isn't able to proceed.
{quote}It's taking longer than usual to load this page. Give it a few moments, then try loading. If it still doesn't load, speak to your Confluence admin.
{quote}
In the server side, the following error is shown.
{code:java}
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Error while processing callback: com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxIOException: Invalid white space character (0x8) in text to output
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.Streamables$XmlStreamWriterTemplateStreamable.writeTo(Streamables.java:104)
com.atlassian.confluence.impl.content.render.xhtml.analytics.MetricsCollectingMarshaller.lambda$marshal$0(MetricsCollectingMarshaller.java:55)
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.transformers.DefaultFragmentTransformer$NonXmlSubstreamable.writeTo(DefaultFragmentTransformer.java:277)
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.transformers.DefaultFragmentTransformer$AggregatedXmlStreamable.writeTo(DefaultFragmentTransformer.java:295)
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.storage.StorageXhtmlTransformer.transform(StorageXhtmlTransformer.java:41)
... 329 more
{code}
h3. Notes

The symptom and error message is similar with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42851, but this is triggered by a mention, not an image
h3. Workaround

This happens when the affected user has some unexpected space (  ) used in his full name.
!スクリーンショット 2019-03-06 13.17.47.png|thumbnail!
 # Access [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] and log in as the affected user
 # Remove the space in the full name(and add again, if necessary)
fields.summary: Editing page shows an error when certain user is mentioned inside that page
